channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trying to Survive Gaza’s War-Torn Present, and Hoping for a Future
item.description: Two years of intense warfare in Gaza have left its people with a dismembered and disordered society. The destruction is vast and many Gazans have ment...

item.title: Internal Audits Shed Light on Ukraine’s Secret Weapons Spending
item.description: The government reviews show the country’s challenge as U.S. support wanes and Kyiv pivots to production from a domestic arms industry with a long hist...

item.title: French Prime Minister resigns after less than a month in office
item.description: Facing criticism from all sides, France's new prime minister Sébastien Lecornu resigned less than 24 hours after naming his government and after less ...

item.title: The medicine Nobel Prize goes to 3 scientists for work on peripheral immune tolerance
item.description: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi were honored for research into how the body helps the immune system avoid attacking your own tissu...

item.title: Civil rights jobs have been cut. Those ex-workers warn of ICE detention violations
item.description: After layoffs, it's unclear how many people are policing civil rights violations inside the Department of Homeland Security, even as the Trump adminis...

item.title: CBS' next top editor to be Bari Weiss of The Free Press
item.description: CBS' parent company will buy The Free Press and install Bari Weiss, its contrarian founder, as editor in chief of CBS News.

item.title: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu Resigns
item.description: Sébastien Lecornu stepped down less than 24 hours after he had formed his cabinet.

item.title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine Is Awarded for Work on Immune Systems
item.description: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi were awarded the prize for research showing how the body regulates its immune responses.

item.title: Amid funding cuts and public health battles, NIH issues autism research grants
item.description: Cornell University will receive $5.1 million as the Trump administration seeks to find a source and cure for autism.

item.title: We May Know Why Ernest Shackleton’s Endurance Really Sank
item.description: The explorer’s journey to Antarctica was likely doomed before it began.

item.title: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu Resigns
item.description: Sébastien Lecornu stepped down less than 24 hours after he had formed his cabinet.

item.title: Jilly Cooper, British Romance Novelist, Is Dead at 88
item.description: A prolific writer and keen observer, she sold millions of copies of her juicy, sometimes racy “Rutshire Chronicles” series.

item.title: We May Know Why Ernest Shackleton’s Endurance Really Sank
item.description: The explorer’s journey to Antarctica was likely doomed before it began.
